text: On draft during 4W tap takeover at BoxCar with Ash. Pours a hazy blonde with a white head. Taste is sour with passion fruit notes. Taste is pretty the same. Very pleasant and refreshing.

Super hazy pale golden coloured body with a nice, three centimetre tall pure white head. Aroma of very light sour grapes, passionfruit, wheat, light sugars and a bit more sourness - nice. Super light-bodied; Strong passionfruit flavours with not much body nor complexity, but a nice sour flavour at first and a very easy-to-drink smooth wheatie taste. Aftertaste shows a nice sour grape and passionfruit flavour with a little coriander seed, but a freshness that is mouthwatering and makes you want to drink even more! Overall, a great beer, and definitely nice to try as the weather got warmer! I sampled this ten ounce pour on draught at the Pourhouse in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada on 05-June-2015 for CA$4,50.
Lunch beer, pours a hazy golden colour with a thin head. Lovely passionfruit nose. Light sourness, moderate passionfruit. Overall not bad and refreshing.

Rating #1768 - 2015.06.26 - On tap at Alibi Room - Pours a bubbly light yellow with a decent head - medium retention. Aroma is passionfruit, mild funk. Palate is tart, notes of passionfruit, lemonade. Medium carbonation. Extremely refreshing.

Growler shared by tom10101, many thanks bro! It pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of real, natural passionfruit juice. Taste is of passionfruit juice with a perfectly dialed in acidity. Body is light, carbonation moderately high and mouthfeel is juicy. Awesome, really. Like someone mentionned below this is basically just some alcoholic carbonated passionfruit juice but it is so good! I need to move closer to Four Winds, man.

growler. hazy very light golden with a small white cap, minimal retention and lacing. passionfruit explosion, pineapple, lightly astringent berries, cranberry goat cheese, light and on-the-spot acidity - lactic; average carbonation, light body - not watery; dry, gently tart and very fruity tropical finish. exceptional fruit berliner.

How: Growler (1 L). From kcherney, thanks! Split 4-ways. 

>>> Amazing tart and fruity Berliner Weisse! 

+  The nose is incredibly juicy passionfruit 
+  Its light but nevery watery, super drinkable and quenching 
+  Tartness level is perfect, never overpowering, but really refreshing

Flavors:  Passionfruit (super juicy), lemon, mineral/herbal notes

Growler shared by Tom. Hazy gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is, wow, so much passion fruit, very punchy, super juicy fruit aroma, just cant take my nose out of it. Taste is very juicy, light beery lemonade, passion fruit juice, very mild tartness, light lactic notes, mango yogurt. Palate is light, good carbonation, quite dry. Sublime.

2015-06-28, draught at Alibi Room, Vancouver, 8-3-7-3-15=36Once again, the aroma delivers what is expected; the mouthfeel is a bit soft, the flavor seems less acidic and more yeasty, and the passion fruit flavor is moderate. The final should be more sour.Still a very good beer for the summer.2015-05-30, draught at Pop Up Restaurant, Four Winds event, Vancouver, 8-3-8-3-17=39Murky blond color, a bit orangey, no head. Strong and fresh aroma of passion fruit. Light, dry, citrusy flavor, moderately sour, with a touch of wheat bread, and plenty is passion fruit. The final is a bit short, it could take some more sourness.You know its just beer and fruit juice, but its excellent.

Draught at Darby's. Cloudy orange, no cap. Aroma is tart passion fruit, a bit of compost, and funky sock juice. Taste is tart, tangy and sweet. Palate is clean, crisp, refreshing, slightly sticky, and a low dry finish.
Murky, no head, looks like ass. Smells beautiful, just great passionfruit. Delicious, juicy, utterly refreshing. Sweet and tart passion fruit. Very good.
Draft - Lots of sweet tart passion fruit.  Cloudy gold with a thin white head.  Tons of sweet tart passion fruit.  Ready nice and refreshing and tons of fruit.

On tap at the Four Winds Pop-up Restaurant event, pours an opaque cloudy peachy orange yellow with a small white head. Nose brings out loads of fresh passionfruit, with a touch of tartness. Flavour is juicy and fruity and only lightly tart - lots of passionfruit, light citrus and medium tartness. Perfectly balanced and wonderfully drinkable. Excellent.
